name: servicing
content:
servicing noun [U]
(MACHINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of examining a machine and repairing any damaged parts: Bryce has taken the car in for servicing. Household electrics, plumbing, and heating need regular servicing in the same way as your car.
More examplesFewer examplesThe vehicle has a three-year warranty and three years' free servicing. I asked him how he managed the servicing and repair of all this electronic equipment. An extra monthly fixed payment covers all scheduled servicing and maintenance.

servicing noun [U]
(DEBT)
the act of making payments to pay back a debt: The region's debt servicing currently accounted for $9,000 million a year. Rental income may do no more than cover mortgage servicing and upkeep costs. See
service
More examplesFewer examplesFirms typically prioritise the servicing or repayment of debt before paying dividends to shareholders. The company said it expects to spend $200 million more on loan servicing this year.Many house purchasers will regard 5 percent as affordable in terms of mortgage servicing costs.
